Instruction_Text: Etymologically speaking, empathy means to feel into another's experience as if it were your own.

Instruction_Text: Real empathy is not performative.

Instruction_Text: You don't have to show empathy.

Instruction_Text: The primary thing needed to be empathetic is attention.
NLP_Matched: Focus your attention outwards.
AI_Matched: Practice experiential empathy.

Instruction_Text: Because attention to another's words, verbal tone, facial expressions, and body posture stimulates neurons in the brain that create emotional connectedness.
NLP_Matched: Focus your attention outwards.
AI_Matched: Focus your attention outwards.

Instruction_Text: These neurons are called mirror neurons.
AI_Matched: Practice experiential empathy.

Instruction_Text: When mirror neurons fire, they trick our emotional brains into feeling emotions similar to those of the people around us.
NLP_Matched: Treat people as being important.
AI_Matched: Practice experiential empathy.

Instruction_Text: When we witness someone speaking about a moving experience, we naturally and unconsciously mimic their facial expressions.
Purpose_Outcome: someone speaking about a moving experience
NLP_Matched: Practice curiosity about strangers.
AI_Matched: Practice experiential empathy.

Instruction_Text: This facial mimicry sends signals to our emotional brain called the limbic brain.
AI_Matched: Practice experiential empathy.

Instruction_Text: The resulting signals prompt us to attune to the person we're relating to by feeling similar emotions as well.
NLP_Matched: Treat people as being important.
AI_Matched: Practice experiential empathy.

Instruction_Text: So the essential ingredient needed to show empathy is our presence.
NLP_Matched: Practice experiential empathy.
AI_Matched: Practice experiential empathy.

Instruction_Text: If we want to stand in another's shoes, we have to be willing to give them our wholehearted attention.
NLP_Matched: Focus your attention outwards.
AI_Matched: Treat people as being important.

Instruction_Text: It can help to look at their eyes in particular, the eyes of the primary area where we express our emotions.
Purpose_Outcome: to look at their eyes in particular , the eyes of the primary area where we express our emotions
NLP_Matched: Offer help.
AI_Matched: Focus your attention outwards.

Instruction_Text: In addition to presence, it can help to learn a few verbal cues that let the other person know you understand them.
Purpose_Outcome: to learn a few verbal cues that let the other person know you understand them
NLP_Matched: Offer help.
AI_Matched: Practice curiosity about strangers.

Instruction_Text: Occasionally, it can help to reflect what you hear them saying.
Purpose_Outcome: to reflect what you hear them saying
NLP_Matched: Offer help.
AI_Matched: Focus your attention outwards.

Instruction_Text: When you reflect, you're not dissecting, analyzing, or reinterpreting the meaning of their words.
AI_Matched: Focus your attention outwards.

Instruction_Text: Instead, you are accurately summarizing or paraphrasing them.
AI_Matched: Focus your attention outwards.

Instruction_Text: You can repeat what they said with the preface, so what you're saying is, echoing like this lets them know that you hear their words and that you're with them.

Instruction_Text: You won't always be accurate when you echo their words.

Instruction_Text: Often, you will miss the essence of what they're conveying, particularly if you're in an argument with them or they're speaking about a delicate subject, either for yourself or them.
Purpose_Outcome: the essence of what they 're conveying
NLP_Matched: Practice curiosity about strangers.

Instruction_Text: It can be helpful then to follow a reflection with the question, is that what you were saying or did I miss anything?

Instruction_Text: To make a cranberry sauce first pour a bag of cranberries into a colander and rinse them under the sink Remove any stems leaves or dirt that you see Then set the cranberries aside for now in a saucepan add one cup 250 milliliters of water and one and a half cups 350 grams of sugar and mix together Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat stir continuously as it heats up to make sure all of the sugar dissolves Next remove the pan from the heat and carefully add the cranberries Return the pan to the stovetop and bring the water to a boil again Now reduce the heat and let the sauce simmer while the cranberries pop open which should take about 12 minutes Make sure to keep stirring as the sauce finishes up Finally remove the saucepan from the stovetop and let the sauce cool down To chill it before serving pour it into a bowl and refrigerate it for two hours For warm cranberry sauce simply pour it into a bowl and enjoy
